alert.note: Alert for Union (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 19 at 8:53PM EDT until July 19 at 10:45PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... North Central Union NC County in the piedmont of North Carolina... * Until 1045 PM EDT. * At 853 PM EDT, Doppler radar and rain gauges indicated that 1 to 3 inches of rain fell over the Goose Creek stream basin over the past two hours. In addition, water is draining east from stream basins in Mecklenburg County into the Goose Creek basin in western Union County. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and stream gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Indian Trail, Stallings, Hemby Bridge and Fairview In Union County. Flooding is very likely along Howey Bottom Road and along Highway 1524 near Indian Trail. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
